name: Divination Magic
description: Diviners are masters of foresight and discernment, capable of peering into the past, present, and future. They excel in spells that reveal hidden truths, provide supernatural insight, and foresee events.

divination_savant.description: At 2nd level, the gold and time required to copy a Divination spell into your spellbook is halved.
benefits: Halve the gold and time required to copy Divination spells into your spellbook.

portent.description: Starting at 2nd level, you gain glimpses of the future. After a long rest, roll two d20s and record the numbers. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature you can see with one of these rolls. Each roll can be used only once, and you lose any unused rolls after a long rest.
benefits: Roll two d20s and record the results after a long rest.
Replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check with one of these rolls.
Each roll can be used only once.

expert_divination.description: At 6th level, casting divination spells costs less of your spellcasting resources. When you cast a divination spell of 2nd level or higher, you regain a spell slot of a level lower than the spell you cast and no higher than 5th level.
benefits: Regain a spell slot of a level lower than the divination spell cast (up to 5th level).

the_third_eye.description: Starting at 10th level, you can use your action to enhance your perception with one of the following benefits, lasting until you are incapacitated or take a short/long rest: Darkvision (60 ft.), Ethereal Sight (60 ft.), Greater Comprehension (read any language), or See Invisibility (within 10 ft.).
benefits: Ethereal Sight: See into the Ethereal Plane within 60 ft.
See Invisibility: See invisible creatures and objects within 10 ft.

greater_portent.description: At 14th level, you roll three d20s for your Portent feature instead of two, providing more accurate foresight.
benefits: Roll three d20s for Portent instead of two.
